item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Martin:

you should use randoms in your waits like wait(4000+random(1000));

Lol. Thanks for the enlightening post.

item.title: Waiting Your Script?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:119348”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=168769.msg1567814#msg1567814 date=1183530800]

Well I was curious about this for some time, the natural human wait between doing things could be very slow, unfourtunately not all of us go from 1 thing to the other without a natural small wait, however, none of my accounts I auto on all night have been banned despite highly detectable scripts so it doesn’t matter.

Ohk, thanks. But surely like moving your mouse etc every 0.1 second would be a bit suspicious…
[/quote]

Yes but since jagex only get mouse movements every 50 milisecs it isn’t really picked up.[/quote]
:o
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Waiting Your Script?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Ohk, hey everyone. I’m just curious. If you wait your script between procedures, does it make it less jagex detectable?
Like, would;

[code]program waitedScript;

const
Message1=‘Hai der’;
Message2=‘Just clearing the debug… Continuing on with script.’;

procedure Hello;
begin
Writeln(Message1);
end;

begin
repeat
wait(4000);
clearDebug;
hello;
wait(2000);
clearDebug;
Writeln(Message2);
until(false)
end.[/code]

Be less detectable, then;

[code]program script;

const
Message1=‘Hai der!’;
Message2=‘Just clearing the debug… Continuing on with script.’;

procedure Hello;
begin
Writeln(Message1);
end;

begin
repeat
clearDebug;
hello;
clearDebug;
Writeln(Message2);
until(false)
end.[/code]

Because it’s waited… And acts a bit more human speed?

Read full topic
